Lady Hawk watched FZ move like a rabbit watches a wolf. She didn't trust any
of the Alliance, especially thier leader. "The prototypes are unpredictable
and instinctive to follow thier own ways, it would be to risky to send them
into battle." she knew how savage and untame her creations were, if they
were loose they'd probably attack anything that moved thinking they were
protecting themselves. "But if you used the DNA scanners from a stasis pod
to add the strengths of my creations to your warriors you'd have a VERY
powerfull warrior."
----- Original Message -----
From: <Yanshosh@...>
To: <nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, June 28, 2001 12:06 AM
Subject: Re: Creative genius


> ::FZ::
>
> "Impressive indeed," FZ replies as he looks over the prototypes. He didn't
want to admit it, but Lady Hawk knew what she was doing.
>
> He looks over at her. "How long untill they are ready? I believe I might
have a mission for them..."
>
>
>
>
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> > Lady Hawk scans her creations one more time before replying. "Thier
growth
> > rate increases each day. these samples are merely two days old and
already a
> > third of the way to thier estimated full size." The stasis field on the
left
> > held a scorpion alien about three feet tall, redish with mandables, half
a
> > claw on each hand, a tail about four feet long. It stood somewhat
hunched on
> > two feet, it's oblong head forward to maintain balance.
> >
> > On the right a snake alien made from Najahs cobra DNA coiled about five
feet
> > tall. Its forked toung dripping deadly venom suitable for melting it's
prey
> > before digesting it. It uncoiled pushing itself to it's full length of
> > aproximately fifteen feet. A dark green crossbread of it's serpentine
scales
> > and the aliens armored almost shelllike skin reflected the light of the
> > room. It flexxed a hood about six feet in diameter. "An impresive sight
if I
> > may be so modest." Lady Hawk was torn by her accomplishment. She was
> > fearfull for what these crossbreeds were to be used for, but she
couldn't
> > help to feel a small bit of pride based on the life she had just
created.
>
>
